title: Extremely responsive to patients
body: I would like to thank the Social Prescriber and GPs at the surgery for being exceptionally responsive to my Mother's needs as an elderly person living with Parkinsons. I have always received a call back on request, and they always follow through and action what has been clearly discussed and agreed upon. I am truly grateful for the help and care she has been receiving at such a difficult time in her life, and also in the context of the challenges the NHS is facing at this time. Thank you for your care.

title: Great pharmacist
body: Huge thanks to Pharmacist 'A' for a really thoughtful and individualised telephone conversation about medication options. The scheduled call was on time and extremely helpful. As always superb care from the CRMP team.

title: Awful service
body:
have been a patient at beacon house since 2015, during this time the communication has been appalling, care has been non existent and continuity as steady as an amateur tight rope walker

I was filled with false promises and hope by the new management and had a meeting with the manager discussing past failures and promises for the future but have since been let down repeatedly.

It took two suicide attempts within the space of 4 months and daily phone calls from my family before even a care coordinator was appointed. Promises of therapy which were delayed repeatedly and no aftercare or safeguarding offered in the interim

Excuses after excuses as to why patients are being let down, constant blaming of underfunding and understaffing. How long can these excuses go on for? If the system is underfunded and understaffed that’s not likely to change any time soon so a new approach needs to be implemented instead of just brushing it off with excuses. Work with what you have.

Whilst not directly related to beacon house, the crisis team are also not worth the time or effort that’s put into the advocation and advertisement of their service.

This weekend family called the crisis team for help and advice as I was in crisis and were told to call police instead. What are they there for if only to answer the phone and pass you around?? If a crisis is being experienced logic would dictate the crisis team are there to deal with it, right? Clearly not…. Absolute joke. Just to clarify I was no longer a danger to myself or anyone else at the time therefore it is under the crisis teams remit…

author: soilkp75
title: Wasting NHS money
body:
My husband got his flu vaccination along with his COVID-19 booster in September 2021 at Ravenscraig. He received an invitation for his flu vaccination in early November. I telephoned the free number and waited 35 minutes to speak to someone who told me that he could not do anything without my husband's authorization. I wanted to cancel this appointment for his flu vaccination as he had already received it. I asked to speak to their manager and they asked me to hold on. After waiting half an hour I had had enough and hung up.  
Last year after my husband had received his flu vaccination he received four more letters inviting him to receive his flu vaccination! I telephoned each time and was never told that I needed my husband's authorization to cancel these appointments.  
It seems to me that people love to waste the NHS's money sending out letters to people that have already received their vaccinations.

author: a_person_not_a_number
title: Community Co-ordination Centre number is not working
body: For a week the telephone number 01483 362 020s has not been working, so this site is the only place I could tell anyone about it. As far as 'how I feel' is concerned I am not surprised that I cannot speak to anyone about my wife's care

author: Mike 321
title: Wonderful experience at Stoke Mandeville Hospital
body:
I attended Stoke Mandeville Hospital in October for an Ultrasound check on my carotid artery. On arrival at the main entrance and not being sure where to go, I was delighted to be met by a superb friendly Welcome Host. The lady was so welcoming and made it very easy for me to feel at home and know exactly where I needed to go.  
I then checked in at the X-Ray Department reception and was met by another friendly and helpful lady who again made me feel welcome and under control. I then waited in the right waiting room and 5 minutes before my appointment time I was called by the Ultrasound nurse - who again was so friendly, helpful and professional. I was shown into the Ultrasound room and met the technician who again was just so reassuring, caring and friendly.  
Everything was completed, I was given a really helpful update and I made my way out. I actually left the hospital only 10 minutes after my appointment time! It could not have been a better, calmer, happier or more effective experience. Thank yo SO much to all the team, both those I met on the day and those other folks who have thought about the patient experience and made it so good. I was so proud of our NHS!!

title: Fantastic Service - So Under Appreciated
body:
Fantastic service, called at 8am, I was 59th in the queue… my heart sank. I selected a automatic call back which worked fantastically, was called 45 minutes later and put through to a very helpful call handler. 25 minutes later I was in seeing a GP.

A lot of people very quick to complain, this surgery offered a fantastic service form start to finish. Credit to all involved.

title: Great service
body:
Needed an urgent blood test for my 6 year old daughter, was able to book in with the nurse the same day as the gp requested the bloods. The nurse was amazing with my daughter who was understandably very nervous and afraid. She was assisted by the care assistant who held my daughters hand and distracted her throughout. 
Blood results were back the next day. Couldn’t as for a better service.
Highly recommended. Thank you all for the amazing job you guys are doing during these very difficult times.

title: Professional all round service.
body: Attended Endoscopy Dept for a Colonoscopy. From the first contact to the completion of the investigation and treatment everything was carried out in a thoroughly professional manner. All staff were polite and courteous explaining each stage of the procedure I was undergoing at the time. This succeeded in putting my mind at ease and making my experience as comfortable as possible. After the treatment all the results were explained to me thoroughly and informed me of any follow up procedures which would follow. Made extremely comfortable with refreshments in the recovery room before being discharged. Overall a very satisfying experience under the circumstance. All staff a credit to their profession. Many thanks.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)

author: scorpiuswq47
title: Good support at home
body:
So, I was first admitted to a PQ ward then transferred to Mansfield mental health hospital, Bassetlaw, 7 years previously. After this I was transferred to Highbury Hospital in which the care I received was very good. They choose not to use restraint unless required and I was not restrained at all. Since 2014 I have had 5 psychotic episodes and having gone down the private care route and from my experience Highbury is the better route to go down.  
My most current episode was dealt with purely at home and the care I received was extremely good. I managed to stay at home with mood stabilisers and anti-psychotic drugs provided by the Highbury Crisis team.  
My only complaint was the care staff do not get passed on enough information while administering care. They also need to let carers know what support is available (eg mum and dad) so that they can access the help needed during a very difficult time.

title: Great service
body: During this pandemic with the immense pressure on GP surgeries I was very grateful that my concerns were promptly addressed following an econsultation. I received a face to face appointment the next day and when blood tests were arranged reception was most helpful by scheduling these promptly and conveniently. A referral was recommended and the paperwork was processed the same day. Throughout the whole process both clinical and reception staff could not have been more helpful.  Thank you and keep up the good work.

author: Frustrated visitor
title: Inconsistent visiting options
body:
My relative is distressed and I am becoming more frustrated as unable to visit in Wester Moffat hospital. When in Monklands we could change the visitor each day meaning more family could visit which helped our relative for stimulation and also supported the family as there was no pressure for same person to visit every day. Since the move the manager has said it's back to one designated visitor who can visit each day but can't change who the visitor is.  
This does not appear to be in line with government or NHS Lanarkshire's policy as it says the visitor doesn't need to be the same every day. This has left our relative distressed as they can't see family. Staff nurses are understanding but are told they are acting on managers instructions. We can't get explanation why Wester Moffat is not following NHS Lanarkshire's own policy. Whilst we completely understand we need to keep each other safe whilst Covid goes on, it's unfair this hospital doesn't appear to follow guidance.

title: Amazing experience!
body:
Had a joint assessment today with a really lovely lady, she made me feel really at ease and was very nice. Listened to everything I had to say, and just made me feel like I was an actual person.
Overall my experience was excellent!

author: attendantff79
title: Contraceptive implant removal
body: Leanne was wonderful. Very friendly and completely put me at ease. She was very helpful with after-care comment what to look out for and tips on which vitamins to take for fertility.

author: Marny64
title: Smoking outside the hospital
body: I recently attended the Direct Assessment Unit and was appalled to see the amount of hospital staff in uniforms sitting on chairs outside the entrance smoking. I thought the hospital was a smoke free zone? It is totally unprofessional and a blatant disregard to hospital policy. How is this allowed to happen?

readBy.name: Northern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Excellent Care
body: From the moment I arrived at reception right through to being discharged I was treated with kindness and consideration. During the booking in process the details were thoroughly checked and the procedure carefully explained. I found the prepping system for theatre to be sleek and timely and I was impressed by the way the team worked together.  I was kept informed at every step and was made to feel involved in the procedure.  I cannot praise the staff enough and indeed must mention the cleanliness of the whole hospital as being excellent. This was my second cataract operation and the aftercare I received from the  team then was also excellent.  I thoroughly recommend anyone using this hospital to do so without any reservation about how they will be treated.

author: Aquarias55
title: My recovery from a spinal infection
body:
To all the staff at both Wishaw and Monklands a huge thank you for your kindness, care and compassion during my recovery from ill health, in particular the OPAT team in Monklands and the doctors for their attention to detail, I will always be very grateful and mindful of the time you gave me in my recovery and the encouragement to be positive at a very difficult time.  
Thank you all

title: I couldn't be happier.
body: I attended Audiology on 9th November 2021 for a hearing re-assessment.  The audiologist explained everything about the tests and upon completion explained the results.  I was prescribed two hearing aids and was lucky enough to have one of the new ones fitted to my existing ear mould which would allow me to get used to it.  The audiologist arranged an appointment for me at the Brigg Clinic to have the new moulds and aids fitted which was wonderful because it will be so much easier than travelling to SGH.  The difference with the new aid is amazing. Please pass on my thanks to everyone involved.

readBy.name: Northern Lincolnshire and Goole NHS Foundation Trust

author: augustyx36
title: Knowledgeable about employment
body:
I were offered an additional worker who worked with me just around looking for work. He worked for the same organisation so I was pleased to be able to be open and honest about my struggles and concerns. He didn’t judge me like job centre and was really knowledgable about employment and sympathetic to getting me into a job that no one else believed I could do. I used to meet him every week and some days I couldn’t go due to some personal issues, but it was fine, I wasn’t made to feel like I had done anything wrong. Instead I felt like back to a normal person by Michael, I could make my own decisions again, and started believing in myself.  
I will never forget his way of reflecting with me and making me believe in my self again. It’s been a few years now, and I am still off the gear, got my income steady. Ready for my next Steps in life.

author: Relht46
title: Amazing care. Treated with respect.
body:
My mother has been a patient in Ward 16 for several weeks and I just want to express our thanks to the doctors, sisters and their teams, for such amazing care. Everyone has been attentive to her needs and she has been treated with respect at all times.  
Other members of the MDT, such as OT, physio, domestic staff, have also contributed greatly to her well-being and we are indebted to all concerned.

readBy.name: South Eastern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Amazing service
body: Taken thoroughly and carefully through A+E.  Observation period and then 12 hrs on amazing Ward 25 Gastro.  So much love, care, humour good training/practices going on.  I was so impressed and grateful.  Thank you everyone.   Anne B

readBy.name: Shrewsbury and Telford Hospital NHS Trust

title: Amazing care
body: I visited A&E today having fallen whilst pregnant.  From the second I arrived I was triaged and reassured.  The care from every individual I encountered was amazing, both medically and in terms of personal care and bedside manner.  The doctors and nurses were amazing and the lady who took my stitches took special care.  Couldn’t have asked for a better, more caring experience.

title: Outstanding Care from Podiatry team
body: My son has been treated for a very nasty ingrown toenail. We have been seen very quickly by an amazing team that were so kind and patient. They totally put myself and son at ease. Thank you so much

title: Brilliant well organised
body: very good, well organised, lovely staff was made to feel very safe, no doubts about staff or surgeons.. very friendly, would highly recommend to anyone

author: MandR
title: My procedure
body:
Hello, I am 9 years old.  
I came to the hospital last Thursday for an endoscopy.  
As I was being admitted at 11am, my mum was unable to let me eat anything after 7.30am that morning. Although all of the staff were friendly and helpful, I was VERY hungry as I didn't go into theatre until around 3.30pm that afternoon.  
Thankfully, I was given a sandwich and some ice cream and jelly after my procedure which I scoffed!  
My mum and I would like to thank all of the staff; from the lovely ladies who gave me my Covid test and a sticker on the previous day (one of whom gave us personal directions to the ward that we would be attending the following day), to the happy nurse who brought me colouring pens and juice, the gentle, kind nurses who checked me over and got me ready, and the pleasant and funny doctors who assured me and mum and kept us at ease throughout.

title: First class practice
body:
The GP I see usually is excellent, she listens and is very effective. 
I am very grateful for the hard work all the team do for us under 
difficult circumstances, not least  government underfunding and crazy policies.

author: Farhat786
title: Wasted my time
body: First of all when I came to my appointment I waited over half an hour to be called around 1.05pm and my appointment was at 12.30 then when I was called in the doctor told me they will not be changing my coil, as my gp have not abided with the guidelines and shouldn’t have sent me for coil change. I have waited too long for this appointment and then they would get personal, I told them I have a scan on Thursday but it’s not connected with this appointment so it’s personal and I do not wish to tell they what it's about, they kept asking again n again to tell them or they can’t continue with the appointment. I was told that my GP should refer me to gynaecologist which I said they have and because the appointment hasn’t arrived and the GP suggest it could be due to the copper coil and requested me to change it to marina coil while I wait for my gynaecologist appointment but this doctor refused and wasted my time and also my fuel. This has made my situation worse. If I had changed to marina coil it could have stopped my problems but unfortunately, this didn’t happen and they sounded so rude.

title: Exceptional service
body: After transferring to Ironbridge Medical in October after experiencing such poor quality of care at my previous practice, it is clear to see the care and compassion this surgery has towards it's patients. The receptionists are extremely helpful, kind and helpful. Nothing is too much trouble for any of the staff and the standards of service are fantastic all round. Very reassured to be a patient at Ironbridge and would 100% recommend to all.

author: caringgp63
title: Endoscopy
body: Lovely experience. Delightful staff. Felt genuine care. Everything very well explained.

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust

author: willieboy33
title: Attentive District nursing team
body:
Having undergone major surgery due to a diagnosis of bowel cancer in December 2020 which left me with staples to close the surgery area on my abdomen. I was referred to the district nurse to remove said staples on my return home and during this procedure my stomach had failed to heal and my wound opened up. The nurse in question who was in attendance remained calm, rational and very professional by giving me assurance and support whilst telephoning for medical assistance. She remained with me until the paramedics arrived and when in hospital it was deemed the wound could not be closed and was dressed accordingly by the hospital staff with a referral to the district nurse team to continue daily dressings.  
This was a positive experience due to the fact that the care and attention I received during this time was second to none. Not only did I receive physical support, there were moments when the staff were attentive in respect of helping me emotionally through this difficult time. I feel my recovery was aided with this invaluable support from the team which included Roz, Siohban and Adam who all treated me with respect, dignity and care which is a testament to their given role. Their attitudes were positive in respect of attuning into my feelings on any particular day, they promoted my well-being and continually reassured me that my recovery will be complete.  
There were days when my mood was low and this was addressed by the staff with their attentiveness and encouragement which was over and above their given role. Roz in particular displayed her true professionalism and referred me to the Tissue Viability team who in turn assessed my wound and administered Pico pump dressings weekly which enhanced my recovery which enabled me to receive Chemotherapy as the open wound would have compromised the treatment.  
Having never been ill prior to my diagnosis, I found not only did I find myself with a serious life threatening condition, I also contracted Covid which added to my distress, However my care continued with the support of the district nurse team and due to their continued efforts, care and commitment I responded well and through time my wound healed and I continued to recover. Today I am doing well and feel I have to have my say in respect of voicing my story. I have nothing but respect for all the NHS staff who were involved in my recovery, particularly given the circumstances in these difficult days and added pressure on our valuable resources. A big thank you especially to the Kilwinning district nurse team.

readBy.name: North Ayrshire Health & Social Care Partnership

title: A6 Excellence
body: Broke my hip in a fall and the kind attentive professionals in A6 were brilliant. Nothing was too much trouble and all done with a smile. The extra mile is the norm and the staff from surgeon to cleaner are a team they can be proud of. Thank you

author: Lm21
title: Concerned about overworked staff
body: I had to have a stay in Dr Grays Hospital after being admitted through the A&E department. I have absolutely no complaints about my care, my concerns are about the overworked staff who are clearly totally exhausted and deflated. I have previously worked at the decline in recent years. Entry to the ward showed corridors full of equipment, laundry etc, is there not a store room? One nurse was on their knees exhausted after a 12 hour shift with no breaks, hardly any drinks with the thoughts of leaving the profession. A shocking waste of nurses time was spent looking for the red folders and equipment. Can the stats machine not be made computerised to avoid this? I had to be on oxygen for a while but there was only one portable cylinder for the whole of the ward which would have to go to other patients needing to go for tests or even the toilet! More often than not it was taken off my bed. At one point I was given the emergency oxygen cylinder because there was really nothing else. The nebuliser was also taken from me as there was not enough. There wasn’t enough water jugs to go round, most of the time it was a disposable plastic cup on our tables with water in it, easily knocked over and not environmentally friendly. Can the volunteers not come back? This would relieve a little pressure on the staff with regards to the tea rounds. The pharmacy I was told, is not open at the weekend, this could mean that, yet again, the nurses suffer by having to get together medication sometimes having to go to other wards to get this. Surely Dr Grays is big enough to have the pharmacy open 7 days? I feel so sorry for the loyal hard working, underpaid staff who are trying to keep it together but unless the management get an urgent plan of action with immediate affect I fear we will lose more of these fantastic workers.

title: Prompt return call
body: got through to a receptionist after waiting for 30 mins - but she was kind, supportive and arranged for a GP to call me. They did so the same morning and were really great. Helpful, kind, empathetic and pragmatic. Offered lots of advice - referred me straightaway to further help and arranged for physio within a week. Thank you so much.

title: Great practice
body: I've received good help and support from this surgery for many years.  The doctors have been spot on in their diagnoses and they  have always referred me to appropriate services where necessary.

author: cjw21
title: Kindness and respect
body: At my appointment I was treated with kindness and respect at all times.

author: Kace
title: Contraceptives
body: I went in staff were nice n they tried there best to help me find a good contraception for me

author: NArnaud
title: I have nothing but praise for all of the staff
body: I had a huge car accident which resulted in major surgery to fix my arms, legs a ruptured artery which resulted in a stroke to recover from too. I was very confused when I first found out what had happened and was going on because I couldn't remember any of it. After spells in ICU and high dependency I went to ward 26 neuro rehab for PT and OT. I was always looked after from nursing staff helping me to wash and dry me and also taking me to the toilet. I was given daily physio to aid my legs one which had a rod and the other an external fixator as well as pins and plates in both arms. I'd had part of my skull removed to help my brain after the stroke. I have nothing but praise for all of the staff on the ward who helped and cared for me amazingly during my 6 months stay with them even lifting my very heavy frame off the bed for me when needed. Their excellent care is the reason I've decided to have my baby there later this month.

readBy.name: South Tees Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Good PracticeI
body: I was given good immediate attention with full examination both verbally and physically. Was given diagnosis with instructions to attend A & E immediately in Medical Decision  Unit.  There were 9 people before me, waited about 2 hours then Triage. Into Ward, examination by Nurses for Cannula, ECG, then into women's  ward. Doctor fully examined verbally and physically, he told me I would need blood tests, X-ray and perhaps CT die Scan. All of this was done and Doctor told me good news, not clot but Scan report days Nodule! Report going to Respiratory Department. Reported back to GP Doctor as requested. Contacted Respiratory Department's Secretary who will let me know. All in all a very kind and helpful procedure. Very good Service, Thankyou GP Practice and Hospital Staff.

author: Abcde123
title: Cared for my family with kindness
body: Just wanted to say a massive thanks to the A&E staff who not only helped care for my brother at his sudden end of life, but who also cared for my family with kindness and patience as they/ we went through it. Palliative care is never easy, but to do it to such a good standard in a challenging a&e environment shows how professional and caring the staff in a&e are. Thank you.

title: Friendly, efficient and very professional service
body: Over 50 years my family and I have been very well supported by all the staff at WHMC. Our concerns have always been taken seriously and we have received sound advice and excellent care.

author: Elsfk75
authorRole: a staff member posting for a carer/relative
title: A&E was disappointing
body:
A&E was disappointing. I attended an appointment on Monday and then received a phone call late in the evening on Tuesday stating I must go to A&E immediately as my blood results are back and I need emergency treatment. I arrived at A&E the staff member in triage that was doing the covid tests was rude and asked me why I had a bag. I explained and they said that all patients had an emergency and I would have to wait at least 13 hours to be seen. I explained to the nurse in triage and they said they would speak with the doctor. I did have to wait in the waiting area for 4 hours before being seen by the doctor. I don’t understand why I was rushed out of bed late at night due to medical emergency but then not treated when I arrived.  
I was then transferred to 4 North and the care is good but the room is cramped. There are 3 patients in a double side room. I would like to improve wait times.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Sorry used to be a great surgery
body: Impossible to get a face to face appointment after waiting nearly an hour to get through on the phone then being told no appointments just feels like no one cares anymore, people are suffering with no where to turn yet being told on tv that you can see a doctor face to face why even bother anymore even harder when you work. I have given up trying. Used to be such a great surgery what happened?

title: Helpful Reception Staff
body: I have always found the reception staff to be helpful above and beyond there role, never had a problem with them, they always accommodate when possible.

title: Worst experience
body: I have recently joined after years else where. I would not recommend this GP practice at all. Post Covid most people are back to work properly. However, there is such a struggle to just get a call back. Receptionist is rude, if you want to see a gp you should be able to. It is our right to ensure our health and wellbeing is looked after. Going online to request call backs is ridiculous. The health of the patient has been forgotten here.

author: Carole35ph
title: Visit for outpatient procedure
body:
I felt so well cared for from start to finish. I was having an endoscopy, which by its very nature is a rather painful, embarrassing procedure. I was apprehensive, but from the minute I stepped inside the department I was reassured by every member of staff from health care assistant to surgeon and left feeling like the queen couldn’t have had better care.  
Well done NHS Scotland ❤️

author: Trobinson91
title: The best receptionist
body:
In my whole 30 years on this planet I’ve never come across a nicer receptionist or GP. It usually seems like people are always moody and don’t want to help…  
So that’s why I have to speak so positively when I come across people so helpful and kind and caring. After moving back from Glasgow to London I was struggling to find a GP to register at. I have a lung disease which requires medication. The Lawson practice was the last practice I was willing to try and register myself and 3 children at after trying a total of 7 gp surgeries it seemed the Lawson practice were the only people in my catchment area. I was already feeling a bit low but I knew I had to get help for my breathing.  
The first receptionist I handed my documents across the desk to couldn’t have been nicer. I later found out this young woman was named Asia. I have extreme social anxiety which makes it hard for me to do simple tasks which others might find easy such as registration for example. Even though it’s for my own health. I still cannot seem to bring myself to do it. Asia registered me with ease and every appointment since she has gone above and beyond to try and help me as best as she can, if she can’t she certainly finds someone who will but she’s usually the woman for the job.  
Then there’s my lovely GP Dr Ali. Wow what a woman. I refuse to see anyone else because as I said I am extremely anxious and I prefer continuing care with the same professionals. Dr Ali has also gone above and beyond and her contributions to the GP practice should not be overlooked. She is a remarkable doctor. I always feel like a weight has been lifted off my shoulders when I see Dr Ali.  
Both women are amazing and they have definitely made me have a much more positive experience with your practice. I hope this message is passed on to both women as they truly do make the world a nicer place and continue to do so.  
Thank you ladies for your support. I truly do appreciate it.

author: Sangje
title: Sensitivity, skill and kindness.
body:
I am 7 days after a hysterectomy in Edinburgh Royal Infirmary (ward 210) and I wanted to thank all the teams involved from the admin support staff who put up with so much (e.g. my anxious phone calls) under pressure , the surgical and anesthetic teams and of course the wonderful ward staff.  
From the start of my 'journey' everyone has been marvellous - the surgical team and anesthetists listened carefully to my special circumstances and complexities and were 'human' , attentive and approachable which made a huge difference .  
The ward staff were without exception kind and compassionate and nothing was too much trouble despite them obviously being very busy. In particular the students put in so much effort to be thoughtful and attentive. Special mention to the young midwifery student who accompanied me to theatre so that I really felt I had a friend on my side ! Everything was dealt with with sensitivity, skill and kindness.  
Thank you !

author: magpiesn39
title: No diabetic eye screening in west Belfast
body:
I have an appointment for a diabetic eye screening test. The thing is, its at the Knockbracken Health Centre on the other side of Belfast, which means at least two buses for me to get there, and at least two buses for me to get back home. One of my appointments is at 17:30 when its already dark, and I have quite a long walk from the bus stop. I like the idea of taking the car straight there, but I'm the only person in my family who drives, and if I go there and get the drops in my eyes, I can't drive home again, so that's not an option.  
I was talking to a member of staff about my travel difficulties involved with my appointment, and they explained that we don't have any similar services in West Belfast. I find this astounding, that they ask this of people my age, over seventy.  
There are health centres down the road, and the Royal Victoria is only a bus away, even my own GP used to do this screening at my local surgery. For what reason did they get rid of all these options, and leave me faced with such hurdles to get the tests I need? Heaven knows.

readBy.name: Belfast Health and Social Care Trust
Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)
Ulster University, Faculty of Life and Health Sciences
Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2022)

author: AnneU
title: Excellent Home vaccination service
body:
I would just like to highlight the fantastic service I have received from the Home Vaccination Team at Ravenscraig Motherwell.  
I have now had three separate experiences with this excellent Team starting with Gillian the Team Leader.  
Gillian went above and beyond when I didn't know where to start. I had three very worthy people who needed to get their vaccines at home.  
One had Cancer and is no longer with us, My Mother-In-Law, and a neighbour who hasn't been out of her house for years.  
And to be totally honest, I was banging my head off a brick wall. I tried the telephone number it gives you with the letter, I got nowhere.  
Then I tried their G.P's , and various Health Clinics in this area and got nowhere either. I was getting really upset by this time  
Then Gillian and her team came into to play. They were excellent kind, caring, and very professional.  
They went more than the extra mile, If the N.H.S. has any employee recognition awards, then I want to highly recommend Gillian and her Team.  
They have restored my faith in the N.H.S  
Look forward to some feedback from you.

title: Flu jab shambles
body: Appointments need to be made for people to attend for flu jabs. Arrived to find lengthy queues and people waiting outdoors in the cold. Nowhere to shelter if it rained and nowhere for anyone to sit if needed. Only one nurse giving injections. The car park hadn't been opened causing people to park on the road to the annoyance of local residents. This needs to be much better organised!

title: Oken Ward
body:
We sadly lost my mother after a short stay due to heart failure.
I can honestly say the staff were truly wonderful and we felt went above and beyond explaining each stage of what to expect once we knew no more could be done for her.
You could see how hard they were all working and we can’t thank you enough for making mum comfortable in her last hours of her life.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)

author: CatherineS
title: Amazing Maternity services
body:
I couldn’t have been happier with my experience with the Craigavon Maternity team. Between 6 weeks and 26 weeks, I had HG and was in the assessment unit on numerous occasions to be put on a drip, the staff seen me efficiently and made me feel comfortable every time.  
I was induced at the start of October and can honestly say the experience from start to end, even though it didn’t go to plan, was amazing.  
Lucie was the midwife that broke my waters, she was amazing! Her honesty, sense of humour and ability to make you feel calm in a terrifying situation was incredible. I genuinely can’t tell you how thankful for her, her advice and words of wisdom I am. She made the whole experience.  
The student midwife was there when my beautiful baby boy was born. I had a difficult delivery as my epidural failed and I was pushing out a 9lb 4oz baby after a 32 hour labour, but she was amazing in calming me down and talking me through the process.  
Dr Stewart was the doctor that eventually had to use the vacuum and her honesty and efficiency was second to none.  
All of the midwives on the maternity ward after delivery were incredible, ensuring we had everything we needed, helping to adjust to breastfeeding and making the whole experience enjoyable.  
My partner and I have both said, as horrific as the labour could have and should have been, the midwives, doctors and the care that I received left me feeling nothing but positivity and joy.  
Thank you CAH!

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)
Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Hold position 34 in the queue! (Follow-up)
body: When staff are training in normal working hours and you call in, you are automatically diverted to a queuing system that puts you on hold, tells you your position in the queue and then just cuts you off after an hour if you don’t get answered in that time.  It think staff answering these reviews are unaware of this queuing system when they divert.  I rang Sprotbrough surgery (787112) got transferred and then got cut off both times.

title: Half an hour on hold then cut off
body: Every time I try to call the practice I have to wait over 30 minutes before someone answers. Last week I tried 3 times and after waiting over 30 minutes each time I eventually got cut off on each occasion. Therefore, after waiting over 1.5 hours to get through on the phone I decided to go into the practice to try to speak to someone, the waiting room was empty! I am hearing the same reports from so many people including pensioners and disabled people who can't always get into the practice to speak to someone so are having to hold for over an hour which in my opinion is totally unacceptable. This has been going on for months and is not just a recent issue.

title: promised an Emergency GP appointment
body:
Called on 9th of November and was put through to the reception. I cordially expressed that my symptoms were getting worse and would like a follow-up/consultation regarding my prescription. Receptionist offered to help book me through to an “Emergency GP appointment” and told me that the GP will ring me anywhere from 2pm to 5pm. And so I waited on my phone. However, throughout the 3 hours, no call was made or given. 
I can’t even tell you if this is a joke at this point.

title: Outstanding Practice
body: Fabulous services provided by Doctors and Support staff. Very professional and courteous. Brilliant with the services provided during the Covid Impacted period there was no hesitation in calling me over to the surgery for 1 to 1 ( Face to Face Consultation). One of the best practices I have come across in UK. Sanjeev Gulati

title: Generally unhelpful.
body: Unfortunately, i am very disappointed by Grove Surgery and greatly regret leaving London where i experienced much more help and advice for my mother. I have had no help or advice at all whilst caring for my mother who has dementia. We have been offered no help at all, and no one will visit my mother from Grove Surgery. Where is the help?

title: Not enough nurses and no visible management on…
body:
It’s obvious that all of the regular staff try their best with the resources they have. It’s such a shame that the nurses have to stay in the office doing paperwork for entire shifts. Purposeful engagement should be offered daily, but we don’t even know who our named nurses are. It feels like there are too many patients for the amount of allocated nurses, it would be nice to see nurses able to spend time interacting with patients and therefore improving patient recovery time by getting to know the individual they are then discussing in MDT’s, professional meetings, ward rounds and hand overs. There is a lot of agency HCA’s which makes it difficult to develop any trust as the regular nurses are rarely free for conversation. 
There is sometimes a glimpse of the ward manager, who seems to be able to be involved in decisions about people she’s never had a conversation with. It would certainly improve the ward if the management were more visible and able to help out when the ward is short staffed or struggling due to incidents etc. 
I struggle to believe that people became nurses to then just sit behind a desk and not interact with patients unless it’s extremely brief. 
This is not meant as a negative review as I do believe the regular staff are trying their hardest. I just think that maybe SABP should rethink job roles and work out ways to engage more frequently with patients. Look at what worked at other hospitals and learn from each other. It would be good for the senior matron to make herself more visible and give opportunities to meet with patients about what does and doesn’t work.

readBy.name: Surrey and Borders Partnership NHS Foundation Trust

author: Jmum
title: Impressed by A & E/X-ray Experience
body:
I attended A+E with chest pain and palpitations last week and was extremely impressed by the care I recieved, even though the department was very busy. I was triaged by a lovely staff nurse, Lorna, who helped calm and reassure me as I was frightened and upset. Lorna then passed my care to another lovely staff nurse, Lynsey, who was also very caring and efficient.  
I was reviewed by an excellent ANNP, Amy, who was empathetic, knowledgeable but also reassuring. Amy organised a chest xray which i got reasonably quickly and a lovely radiographer called Helen was very kind, professional and caring during the xray process.  
I knew both A+E and the XRAY dept were under a lot of pressure that morning but the staff remained calm and caring.

title: Fantastic care
body: Last year during lock down my health took a turn for the worst. On a routine visit with the nurse I mentioned I'd lost quite a bit of weight. That was the beginning of over over a year of treatment at the BRI and the GP. I cannot fault the care and compassion shown by all, yes even the poor maligned receptionists, so thank you from a very grateful patient.

title: Great practice
body: The whole team at the practice, starting from the receptionist, to GP’s, nurses etc are always very helpful, doing their best to look after their patients. This has been especially prominent during the Covid Pandemic. Even under such a difficult circumstances I felt that if I needed help and care, they have always been there. Very reassuring.

title: Great Experience
body:
Attended Day Surgery yesterday and experienced a thoroughly professional approach from arriving at the hospital through admission and preparation for the surgery.
Was kept in touch with everything that was to take place and the whole medical team worked together to make the overall experience very positive.
Well done to the whole team right down to the porter who delivered me to my transport at the end of my visit

title: Service with a smile
body: I was recently in the Elmstead day unit for an angiogram. All staff were so helpful, both in the ward and procedure room. They were calm, understood the patients concerns and dealt with each of us as individuals, not just a number on a list. Explanations of what was going to happen and when were clearly expressed. It was good to have a professional and friendly team looking after us. Many thanks.

readBy.name: East Suffolk and North Essex NHS Foundation Trust

title: Very friendly nurse
body: Took Mum for flu jab. Very efficient and nurse was fantastic in Room 7. Reception staff always less than receptive and need to be more attentive instead of chatting to themselves.

title: Very helpful
body: I have found the medical consultants (dermatology) and and the Medical Secretary very helpful and effective. Thank you for your hard work and excellent service. It is very much appreciated

author: happygolucky67
title: Very happy with the whole service
body:
I recently attended an outpatient appointment in the endoscopy department. The care I received from the receptionist to the aftercare team and everyone in-between were amazing. Incredibly friendly and caring, explained everything to me throughout my procedure, I felt genuinely well cared for.  
Mr Jones and his team were great.  
I received including the telephone calls pre appointment.  
Thank you so much

author: Implant
title: Lovely clinic staff
body: I went today to get my implant fitted for the first time. The nurses made me feel very comfortable and were so kind. I have a fear of needles but the nurses helped a lot and explained everything step by step. Very lovely people

author: Elsfk75
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Waiting times in A & E
body: A&E was packed and I had to wait 15 hours to be seen. The waiting area was very cold due to the revolving door constantly going if it only rotating when someone in it is would help keep some heat in. I was then moved to 1 North and it’s very good and a bit warmer. The meals are good and the cleaners work hard but then again I’m not fussy.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Elsfk75
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Noise at night on ward
body:
I attended outpatients for an appointment and they decided to keep me in. The doctor explained everything to me and I felt comfortable being kept in. I was then moved to 1 south and the nurses are great. I get everything I ask for although it can get loud at night and it’s hard to sleep.  
I spoke with the registered nurse and they said they will pass the message on to night staff to ensure bay door is closed to minimise noise.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Very prompt response
body: I filled in the online request at 11.30 pm for an urgent appointment for a suspected chest infection. I was telephoned at 8.55 am the next morning by one of the GPs who had a very kind telephone manner and immediately organised medication to be collected from the pharmacy and gave me helpful advice. My online requests have always been dealt with in a timely and professional way and face to face appointments always a positive experience. Thanks for working so hard during difficult times

title: Physiotherapist
body:
I just wanted to say how impressed I was with the consultations that I have had with the practice physio. 
He took the time to thoroughly listen, to carry out thorough appropriate physical examination without being deflected by what I was reporting but still listening and hearing what I was saying, he made fitting referrals and took my views and opinions into consideration when deciding on how to approach treatment.  Phenomenal service.

author: PtJune16
title: SAC appointment
body: I was asked to attend the clinic for assessment of abdominal pain and suspected gallstones. Service was exceptional from the moment I entered, Kat the ANP was professional, compassionate and excellent at her job. She displayed exceptional communication skills not only with discussing my results but in teaching the medical student who was present also. Excellent service, rapid turnaround and left with medication and a plan.

readBy.name: Aberdeen City Health & Social Care Partnership

title: Excellent service
body: I attended the walk-in urgent treatment centre on 9.11 21. I was impressed by the highly professional service. I was able to see a very good GP, have my issue diagnosed and treated. It is unfortunate but understandable that they have had to employ security guards. While I was waiting a woman was behaving very aggressively. The staff dealt with it very professionally. I don't think that some patients realise how fortunate they are to have this service. The practice is not my home surgery and it can be difficult at the moment to see a GP on the day. I wish all surgeries were so well run.

author: Jojo73
title: Learning to walk
body: When I came to the rehab centre, I was unable to walk and had to use a wheelchair. The OT staff gave me the confidence to realise that it wouldn't always be this way, and I was encouraged to do more than I thought was possible. The gym is equipped with good equipment, and I was encouraged to use the walking bars. I also had OTs coming to fetch me from my room and walk with me as part of extra exercise.

author: cheetahdn46
title: Total Knee Replacement
body:
I had a Total Knee Replacement in September 2021, in Ward 10 VHK. Everyone from the cleaners to the consultants were excellent.  
Unfortunately there was only one nurse that spoiled my stay in Ward 10. I happened to need help back into bed, had been using the support of a crepe bandage to help lifting operated leg into bed as advised. Somehow it slipped and I screamed out in agony and a nurse came to my aid, but was told by said nurse I would have to learn to do myself as it was a new knee and had to try, which I had been doing up until the bandage slip. I was very upset and tried to explain the reason for my upset was that I had experienced dislocations in knee since I was 12yrs old. The agony of this is hard to explain unless you have experienced it, so instead of helping me and then explaining how the knee had to be built up I got spoken to like a child, with no compassion.  
I was left in tears. I am not usually someone that would accept someone speaking to me like that. But when you are recovering from what everyone says is a major operation, you are not in the frame of mind to deal with someone like that. Obviously later they must have thought about it and made a point when going off shift to wish me a good nights sleep. I didn't get their name.  
I was still upset when my husband came in to visit me. Unfortunately up until now I haven’t felt emotionally, or physically, strong enough to deal with this. After working in the NHS myself for 10yrs I know how just one member of staff can spoil all the great efforts of everyone else in the Team.

title: Great quality of care given
body:
I am extremely happy with the care I was given by the nurse with my bloods , I get anxious and I feel the care and reassurance I was given was amazing. 
Previous visits to the surgery for appointments with my GP have only ever been positive experience , I find my gp goes above and beyond to find solutions . 
The practice is taking precautions with covid very seriously and I felt at ease and safe. 
I’ve been registered at this surgery for my whole life and have only ever found their efforts great . Will recommend.

title: A very special service
body: Whilst the building was dated and a little shabby, the service and the welcome was excellent. We felt comfortable and well cared for. We understood the next steps and were overall very pleased with our consultation. The lady was kind and reassuring.

title: Insomnia Service
body: Suffering from insomnia, I was referred to the service earlier this year by my GP.  Through a series of telephone consultations with exercises and therapy, my sleep patterns have improved enormously.  I am happy to recommend the service to anyone else suffering.

readBy.name: Royal Surrey County Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

title: Quick response following e-consultation
body: I filled out an e-consult request and received a call from the GP within 2 hours. She listened patiently to my concerns and gave clear advice while explaining her reasons. I did not detect any condescension as sometimes happens when doctors talk to patients.

title: No chance of an appointment
body: Can't book appointments in advance which means it's impossibleif you work and have a busy schedule. They tell you to phone at 8am, on hold for 45 minutes to be told no appointments and to call tomorrow. Caught in this cycle for 3 months. Receptionist was unhelpful and uncaring.

title: Hard to Contact
body: Phone line is always too busy and when eventually you get into the queue, the average hold time can be anything from 3mins to 120 mins. Recently I was on hold for 90 mins only for the line to cut off. Any phone appointment always seems rushed and we have had the wrong information sent to our hospital, thus setting back important referrals.

author: Steph2011
title: I was truly given a gift
body:
I found this service after a selection of factors in my life were just becoming too much and too overwhelming. I wasn't sure if 'counselling for depression' was really for me but I was totally wrong.  
I have had 6 sessions with Eunice and I really think she has changed my life. She has helped me to explore why I think in a certain way, and she has asked me to question why I've lived in a certain way, and by doing this - rather than just helped me to deal with the current situation (which is what I was expecting) Eunice has given me tools for life. I honestly think she has changed me forever and I have never had a more positive view about myself or felt more confident about how to navigate my life. I can never thank her enough.

title: Appointments
body: I phone the surgery  this morning about my 11 year old son.. not only did I not get an appointment  I couldn't even get in a queue to speak to a member  of staff. This surgery  has never been the best but you would think you would at least be able to speak to an actual  person  before they told you no..

title: Brilliant
body: Just wanted to tell you that I feel privileged to be a patient at this amazing practice. My designated GP makes me feel as if I were the only patient and the reception staff and nurses are very caring and attentive at all times. You have all given the best service during these difficult times so a big Bravo to each and every one of you.

author: Jumping jack
title: The care I received was first class
body: The care and attention I received in the endoscopy department at Royal Cornwall hospital was excellent. Every step of the colonoscopy was explained and the care I received was first class. Many thanks to everyone there - first class team of staff. Many thanks

author: Jack1955
title: Helpful music therapy sessions
body:
My wife died from cancer in June 2021. I had cared for her by myself most of the two years between her diagnosis and her death. Because of Covid her family were not allowed to see her. Her doctor and nursing did all they could even though they were spread very, very thin trying to save lives. My wife was terminal so the NHS resources had to be used where it could save life. I understand that but it was hard.  
I met with Anna once a week via Zoom. Anna is a musical therapist attached to the Kilbride Hospice. The sessions with Anna were very supportive and helpful and I was able to think positively think about the future. I am grateful for these sessions. They changed my life.

title: Great service
body:
This is the third time I have attended for an eye appointment.

Each time I’ve attended I have been seen within two or three minutes. I am extremely pleased and well satisfied with the service I have received from health harmonie.

title: A great service
body:
I visited A&E having fallen over whilst running with my dog. Despite there being 20 or more people there, I was triaged within about 30 mins and almost straightaway taken through for an x-ray on my hand - a friendly experience and once x-rayed, I was called straight through to a very pleasant and professional ENP who showed me that my hand was not broken and he called through to the Maxillofacial ward. Again I was called through very quickly by a junior doctor who made an assessment of the cuts on my face and secured a room within about 15 mins. The doctor was really lovely to be treated by - she was engaging and informative, and worked through the paperwork quickly and with her full attention. I was subsequently treated by her and a nurse who both did a fabulous job, not just of stitching the wounds, but also chatting with me to take my mind off the difficult moments. I was given all the information I needed and fixed up a follow-up appointment with the same doctor to remove the stitches a week later. 
Thankfully I rarely need the facilities of the Princess Royal Hospital, however I wanted to record that my recent experience was of a friendly, efficient and professional team working well together - which I know can be extremely difficult to achieve. 
In particular I thought the care and attention given me by the Maxillofacial doctor was excellent which belies the image people have of large, 'faceless' organisations.

readBy.name: Shrewsbury and Telford Hospital NHS Trust

title: Fantastic practice
body: My husband had a TIA on Sunday evening and after serious problems with both 111 and our surgery on Monday morning I brought my husband into A&E where he was told, after being seen by a GP, that he would be referred to the stroke clinic. I phoned the clinic the next morning to be told that, disappointingly, the referral hadn’t been passed on. The stroke nurse could not have been more helpful and understanding and arranged for a scan and an appointment with the Consultant for that day.I can’t praise him enough - the other people in this saga have a great deal to learn from him

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)

title: Great Doctors - if you can get through to them!
body:
The waiting time is ridiculous, If I call at 7.55 I am already 85th in the queue which means a good 45 minute wait, but frequently get cut off and have to call back - then start at the end of the queue again.
Why not book online appointments and then call back (as you currently do) to prescreen for covid? Not all patients need to come to the surgery anyway, so the prescreen could be done at this stage.
This would take pressure off patients and reception staff and would enable people with general non-urgent enquiries to talk to reception staff?

title: Very worrying
body: We have used Child Okeford Surgery since 2010 and were delighted with the service for 8 years. How things have changed and the decline started before Covid imposed an extra strain. Very long waiting time on the phone; virtually impossible to see someone face to face; an impersonal disinterested impression is given overall. I feel sorry for those doctors who work hard and have their patients’ interests at heart. They are battling against failed management and an unwieldy over-large practice resulting from the merger of three surgeries. There is no consistency in the doctor you consult. Often they are new to you and completely ignorant of your medical history. I waited for a telephone appointment in order to consult a doctor I used to see, and tests were set up. Unfortunately the ´feed-back’ came in the form of a brief letter from another GP informing  me that the results were not satisfactory and that my medication had been changed. There was no more detail though I was invited to telephone if I was concerned. This was from the same person who shortly before had written to say that I might benefit from statins. Had they read my notes or even my prescriptions they might have noticed that I have been taking statins for more than 15 years. Non of this is reassuring.

title: No answer at all in main appointments line
body: I have called the appointments line 5 times and waited for over 20 minutes. No one answers and I'm told by my GP that this is the only local centre. It is disgraceful in this area that you can't access a service for contraception changes.

readBy.name: Central and North West London Mental Health NHS Foundation Trust

title: No service at all
body: Tried to call 111 on a Saturday morning a couple of weeks ago. No answer at all held on for about 30 minutes and did not get to speak to anyone. Tried on a couple of more occasions and same story. Did not get to speak to anyone at all. This appears not to be a responsive services for out of hours health care.

title: Professional, Quick and Efficient!
body: I used the AskMyGP tool to speak with one of the Paramedics at the practise, he was extremely polite and professional when dealing with my issue and explained everything with expert detail. The practise then organised a blood test within the next few days and have said the results will be back within the next week. Couldn't have asked for better service - Thank you to all the staff at Concord, the hard work is appreciated!!

title: Communication
body: There is no communication with patients .I have been waiting for a CT scan since August every time I ring I’m told something different ,it’s so frustrating.

title: Waste of time
body:
The staff at this G.P’s can’t bothered to do there jobs properly. 
The admin staff have not got a clue what they are doing and give out wrong information. 
Some of the nurses and G.P’s can’t be bothered to do there jobs and rush the appointment and never go before they are due to close as they are rude and do not want to do the appointment properly.
Even when booking appointments online you don’t get a phone call then when you ring up to check it’s some pathetic excuse.

Find somewhere better to go this place should be closed down.

title: Unable to get appointment/get through by phone or…
body: Tottington used to be such a good service. Now you have to go online to make an appointment, this service is now fully booked up by 8am everyday. Then an hour on hold To be told emergencies only. I’ve been trying to get an appointment for 3 days . Eventually offered a triage appointment. The service is diabolical , as for ageing patients I feel sorry for them.

title: Empathetic and efficient staff
body: Yesterday I visited the minor injuries department and x -ray.  All the staff were kind and efficient.  The hospital itself is spotless.  Great service.

readBy.name: Queen Victoria Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

title: Small alterations could lead to an even better…
body:
On screen, or advice from receptionist, if nurse or doctor is dealing with an emergency.
When telephoning please alter “currently receiving high levels of demand”.  I have rung many times in the last month when this has not been the case.  Rest of text could be shortened, giving the same 
information.
When doctors ring and are unable to reach you please could they give a period of time when they will ring you back, or when you could ring the surgery.  I have wasted valuable doctors’ time unintentionally being out of reach. eg in the shower, out of mobile range.  I sincerely apologise for this.

I, and my husband have received excellent service from the health professionals at the surgery.  The receptionist seems overworked at busy times, and has always done her best when I have made my frequent visits.
I would politely request the manager to revisit and improve parts of the service.

title: Awful
body:
Tried calling the surgery, after a 20 minute wait on hold I eventually spoke to somebody only to be told all the appointments are full for the next 2 weeks and to call back tomorrow, not impressed.
I then decided to complete the e-consultation form on Monday, Tuesday I had a text telling me they would be in touch. Wednesday I received a text saying on 16/11 (no time specified) I would receive either an email, text or possibly a call. The system is no inefficient and frustrating!
